New Records: The Astros lost four home games in the postseason for the first time since 2019.
Cristian Javier struggled in his postseason start, allowing three runs and four hits in the first inning.
Key Match Events: Cristian Javier recorded just one out and was replaced in the first inning.
Corey Seager hit a 440-foot home run for Texas.
The Rangers scored 11 runs, including a big inning in the fourth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Astros were aiming for their first repeat championship since 1998-2000.
Dusty Baker highlighted the team's recent success but acknowledged the difficulty of losing consecutive titles.
Post-Match Reflections: Dusty Baker expressed pride in the team's resilience but acknowledged the loss.
Alex Bregman was disappointed in the Astros' execution and performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in Houston, where the Astros had a 39-42 record during the regular season.
The Astros' losing streak at home in the playoffs set a new record.
